definitions.definition: The inhabitants of Albi , a city in southern France .

A sect of reformers opposed to the Roman Catholic Church in the 12th century AD, considered heretics who were subject to the Albigensian Crusade ; a branch of the Catharists , distinct from the Waldenses .

main_definition: The inhabitants of Albi , a city in southern France .
secondary_definitions: ( historical , Christianity ) A sect of reformers opposed to the Roman Catholic Church in the 12th century AD, considered heretics who were subject to the Albigensian Crusade ; a branch of the Catharists , distinct from the Waldenses .
